sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Service Recognition Board Termination Act.

sections.heading: The books, records and documents of the Service Recognition Board,
sections.text:
which have been transferred to the Archives Division of the State Library
for permanent filing, shall be confidential and shall be shown only upon
the authorization of the Governor.

sections.heading: Any person who had a claim which would have been compensable by the
sections.text:
Service Recognition Board except that during the period for filing claims
such person was ineligible by reason of a dishonorable discharge from
service, who prior to July 1, 1953, has or shall have such discharge
reviewed and has obtained or shall obtain an honorable discharge, and any
person who had an amended or supplemental claim pending before the Service
Recognition Board on May 20, 1953 but had not by that date submitted
sufficient evidence upon which the Service Recognition Board could pay the
amended or supplemental claim shall be entitled to have such claim
considered by the Court of Claims and to have an award on the same basis as
if his claim had been fully considered by the Service Recognition Board.
